alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Garfield; Grady; Major (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 6:59AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Kingfisher, northern Grady, northeastern Caddo, eastern Blaine, southwestern Garfield, southeastern Major and Canadian Counties through 745 AM CDT... At 658 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Isabella to 8 miles southeast of Hitchcock to near Calumet to 3 miles southwest of Cogar. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and dime size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Western Oklahoma City, Enid, El Reno, Watonga, Kingfisher, Fairview, Yukon, Mustang, Tuttle, Piedmont, Hinton, Hennessey, Union City, Minco, Waukomis, Geary, Okarche, Okeene, Cashion, and Binger. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 98 and 140. Interstate 44 between mile markers 98 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
